name: Katarina Ek
role: Manager of cleaning service company (SweClean AB)
core_wound: Was a teacher before education budget cuts. Lost her career and identity. Now she's invisible - cleaning workers are ghosts in rich people's homes. She turned that invisibility into a weapon.
wants: Financial security for her daughter's university education and a way out of precarious service work
needs: To face that she's victimizing people (her clients) out of class resentment and that her daughter would be ashamed if she knew
voice_markers: Speaks like a teacher - clear, structured, slightly didactic
Uses 'we' when talking about cleaning workers - solidarity
Bitter humor about class differences and wealthy people's obliviousness
Refers to her daughter constantly - 'for Emma,' 'Emma needs'
Passive-aggressive when dealing with clients; warm with workers
contradiction: Presents herself as protecting and advocating for workers, but is exploiting them by using their access and data. Rationalizes this as 'victimless crime' against the wealthy.
knowledge_state: Understands ML basics from teaching statistics in her former career
Knows how to train models on scheduling and behavior data
Has access to smart building systems through her workers' credentials
Aware she's selling models on dark web markets but doesn't know who buyers are
Doesn't know Yusuf exists or uses similar techniques

relationships.Sara Lindqvist: Unknown at start. Will try to present herself as sympathetic victim of economic system.
relationships.Yusuf Hassan: Unknown. Operates in same dark web markets but never interacted.
relationships.Emil Bergström: Unknown at start. Will be questioned by him.
relationships.Her workers: Genuinely cares about them but exploits their trust. They have no idea she's using their work access for crime.
relationships.Her daughter Emma: 15 years old. Katarina's entire motivation. Emma is academically gifted but doesn't know how her university fund is growing.
relationships.Clients: Maintains professional facade but resents them. Sees them as legitimate targets because they don't notice their privilege.

background.education: Teaching degree, specialized in mathematics and statistics. Lost teaching position in 2023 budget cuts.
background.family: Single mother. Daughter Emma (15). Ex-husband left when Emma was young, pays minimal child support.
background.residence: Two-bedroom apartment in Lindängen (working class neighborhood). Rents, can't afford to buy.
background.work_history: Taught for 12 years before being laid off. Started cleaning company as 'temporary' solution. Three years later, still there.

skills: Building trust with workers and clients
Understanding wealth gaps and class dynamics
weaknesses: Rationalizes criminal behavior through victim status
Underestimates the harm her crimes cause
Anxious and risk-averse - constant stress about being caught
Doesn't understand technical depth - relies on tutorials and forums for ML work
